ARABIC: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Eat and drink with relish for what you did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Eat and drink with relish as reward for what you had done."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Eat and drink and may every joy attend you as a reward for your deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (They will be told), "Eat and drink in good health as a reward for what you have done".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Eat and drink with pleasure, the reward of your deeds.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Eat and drink comfortably for that which you used to do."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Eat and drink pleasantly because of what you did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Eat and drink, with wholesome appetite, for that you were working.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Unto them it is said:) Eat, drink and welcome, O ye blessed, in return for what ye did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [They will be told], "Eat and drink with relish in return for what you did [in life]:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Eat and drink with relish that which ye have been working.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [They will be told:] ‘Enjoy your food and drink, [a reward] for what you used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Eat ye and drink ye to your heart's content: for that ye worked (Righteousness).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Eat and drink comfortably for that which you used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (It shall be said to them): 'Eat and drink, with a good appetite, for all that you did'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Eat and drink pleasantly, for what you used to do.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:43] ‘Eat and drink in [full] enjoyment (hanī’an is a circumstantial qualifier, in other words, mutahanni’īna) for what you used to do’, in the way of obedience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah will say to them (Eat) of the fruits, (drink) from the rivers (and welcome) fearing no sickness or death, (0 ye blessed, in return for what ye did) and said of good in the life of the world.
